top_categories.workout_context: BURGR 95's Wisconsin northwoods gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
BURGR 95's Wisconsin northwoods, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 95 miles.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of BURGR 95. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic BURGR 95's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
At BURGR 95, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
At mile 60 of 95, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 95 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Varied gradients on Wisconsin northwoods gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 95 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,000ft of climbing on Wisconsin northwoods gravel does to your power file on race day.
Tempo is BURGR 95's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 95 miles on Wisconsin northwoods gravel. Train it until it's automatic.
When someone attacks on Wisconsin northwoods gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BURGR 95’s 95 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at BURGR 95 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wisconsin northwoods gravel to build confidence. Expect: wisconsin northwoods, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and G Spot to prepare you for 95 miles of wisconsin northwoods gravel in Gleason, Wisconsin.
